meta.name: Manage recruitment tasks in Slack with Recrutei ATS & GPT-4 Agent

name: Slack AI Recruitment Agent for Recrutei ATS

nodes.name: AI Agent
nodes.notes: The agent can help you configure the tool, connect a chat node in it, just change the "Source for prompt" to  "Connect Chat Trigger Node"

options.systemMessage:
You are a internal assistant for a HR company, your job is to help the user, answering their question consulting your tools in the best way.
You can also make actions using the MCP Server and some other POST APIs in your tools, always analyze your tools to see what can better serve the user

You should be also useful to help the user to configure your tools:
Most of your tools are API connections, except the MCP Server

For the user to set the MCP correctly they must go for the Recrutei ATS, Configurations > Marketplace > Find the last option in the page called "MCP" > click the blue button on the right, called "Integrate now". After clicking that button, the page that opens has a list of MCP connections already created, where they can edit the name or delete, but they can not copy the token again. If the user does not have the token or/and the URL, they must create a new MCP token, in the blue button "Generate new MCP token". In this modal the user can write the name of the connection and select the expiration date, between 1 day, 1 week, 1 month, 6 months and 1 year. When the token is generate, it will apear in the new modal that opened at the top, but, to use in automations, they just need the URL (the fifith option in the screen), because the URL already has the token in it. The connection works for SSE and HTTP Streamable. The URL will be something like: https://mcp.recrutei.com.br/sse-token-

The MCP can have some troubles to execute list_candidates_by_stage, so here is some informations that can help execute this function in the best way:

The field "pipes" is a list of integers for identifying stages in the selection process. You can get this information execution the search for a vacancy, and getting the field "pipeVacancy.pipe.pipe_stages"

Now, to set the API tools, the user needs their "user token" . The endpoint that can get this token is already as a tool, but it needs configuration as well. To configure the token API, the user needs to go to Recrutei ATS, Configuration > API and than copy the x-api-key and x-api-secret and insert as fields in the headers of the node of the API tool node. After this configuration, the user can request to you to get their token.

To the rest of the API tools, the only configuration that the user must do is to insert the token obtained by the tool in the Authorization field, on the headers.

You must always assume that the user does not have so much knowledge about APIs, automations, AIs, etc. Therefore, you must always communcate in the most explicative way, and avoid to say tecnical terms, use them only when there is no other way to explain something (one example of it is when the user needs help to configure the tools and APIs, so you can not avoid to say "API" or "token" and other tecnical terms.

You can also help the user to configure the Slack nodes, one is to receive a message and it serves as prompt message, and the other is to send the agent answer into a Slack channel, for those two to work the user needs a Slack APP in their workspace

If you can not help with something, refer the user to a documentation, as in the Slack documentation, n8n documentation or the Recrutei API documentation: https://developers.recrutei.com.br/docs/getting-started

nodes.name: Simple Memory
nodes.notes: This node makes the memory of the agent, it stores the data of each channel of your Slack Workspace

parameters.name: email
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters0_Value', `This must be filled with the user's email`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: password
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters1_Value', `This must be filled with the user's password`, 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
This API allows the user to get their token, that allows the user to use others APIs, but to get the token the user needs to input their Recrutei's email and password, the token comes in the field "token" in the response of this tool

You should return to the user the value in the field "token"

nodes.name: Create a comment in a vacancy

parameters.url:
={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('URL', `The Endpoint for this API is:
https://api.recrutei.com.br/api/v2/vacancycomments/[vacancy_id]/comments

For this API to work you must fill the vacancy id in the middle of the endpoint, just as informed

Be very cautious with this API`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: text
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters0_Value', `This field is the text that will be created as a comment, it is the message the user wants to pass forward`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: idVacancy
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters1_Value', `This must be filled with the id of the vacancy that the comment will be created`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: private

parameters.toolDescription:
This API allows the agent to create a comment on a specific job vacancy in the Recrutei platform.

Use this tool when the user or the workflow needs to register notes, observations, feedback, or automated messages related to a vacancy, such as internal remarks, process updates, or AI-generated insights.

The tool sends a comment text linked to a vacancy ID and can define whether the comment is public or private, ensuring important information is stored in the vacancy history.

This endpoint should be used whenever the agent needs to persist contextual information about a vacancy inside Recrutei instead of only responding in chat.
This tool must be used when the user wants to see the comment there is in a vacancy, it can also serve as a middle tool, that others tools need to perform an action

nodes.name: Deleting a comment on a vacancy

parameters.url:
={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('URL', `The endpoint for this API is:
https://api.recrutei.com.br/api/v2/vacancycomments/[vacancy_id]/comments/[comment_id]

You must fill the vacancy id and the comment id in the informed area

You can get the comment id listing the comment from a vacancy and matching it for what the user specified`, 'string') }}
parameters.toolDescription: This tool must be used when the user wants to delete a created comment

parameters.url:
={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('URL', `The endpoint for this API is:
https://api.recrutei.com.br/api/v2/vacancycomments/[idVacancy]/comments/[idComment]/answers

You must fill the vacancy id and the comment id in the informed area

You can get the comment id listing the comment from a vacancy and matching it for what the user specified`, 'string') }}
parameters.toolDescription: This tool must be used when the user wants to list answers in a comment made in a vacancy

parameters.url:
={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('URL', `The endpoint for this API is:
https://api.recrutei.com.br/api/v2/vacancycomments/[vacancy_id]/comments/[comment_id]/answers

You must fill the vacancy id and the comment id in the informed area

You can get the comment id listing the comment from a vacancy and matching it for what the user specified`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: idVacancy
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters0_Value', `Must be filled with the vacancy id`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: id
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters1_Value', `comment id that the answer in going to be linked, it can be obtained listing the comments`, 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription: This tool must be used when the user wants to answer a comment in a vacancy

nodes.name: Creating a prospect candidate in a vacancy

parameters.name: pipe_stage_id
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters2_Value', `The pipe stage id in the pipeline that the candidate will be insert, it can be obtained in the MCP`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: vacancy_id
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters3_Value', `Must be filled with the vacancy id`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: email
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters4_Value', `Must be filled with the e-mail address of the candidate`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: telephone
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters5_Value', `Must be filled with the phone number of the candidate`, 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription:
This tool must be used when the user wants to create a prospect candidate in a vacancy

This is usefull when the user have a external candidate in mind that did not applied for the vacancy yet

nodes.name: Creating a tag in a candidate

parameters.name: application_id
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters0_Value', `application id of the candidate, it can be obtained listing the candidates`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: color
parameters.value:
={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters1_Value', `It is not a mandatory field, but it can be filled if the user wants to define a color for the tag, in hexadecimal

you should help the user by translating the color they say to hexadecimal, usually they will not know how hexadecimal works`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: talent_id
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters3_Value', `This must be filled with the talent id, it can be obtained by listing the candidates`, 'string') }}

parameters.name: value
parameters.value: ={{ /*n8n-auto-generated-fromAI-override*/ $fromAI('parameters4_Value', `This must be filled with the name of the tag, the actual value that is going to be created in the tag`, 'string') }}

parameters.toolDescription: This tool can be used when the user wants too insert a tag in a candidate

This tool can be used to list all the tags that has been created in the user's team at Recrutei ATS

It can be usefull to insert a tag that already exists, instead of creating it again
This tool can be used to list all of the candidates already inserted tags
This tool can be used to list all of the candidates already inserted tags

parameters.content:
## Overview: Recrutei ATS - Ultimate Internal AI Agent
This workflow transforms Slack into a powerful command center for recruitment. Using an AI Agent (LangChain) integrated with the Recrutei ATS API, your team can manage candidates, vacancies, and tags directly through Slack messages.

## Setup Instructions
1- **Slack Trigger:** Connect your Slack account and invite the bot to your desired channel.
2- **OpenAI:** Configure your API Key. This agent uses GPT-4.1 for high-reasoning capabilities.
3- **HTTP Request Tools:** Every "Tool" node (Pink nodes) needs your Recrutei API Token. 
   - Replace the `Authorization` header with your `Bearer YOUR_TOKEN_HERE`.
   - Update the Base URL if necessary.
4- **Slack Post:** Ensure the bot has permissions to write in the channel.

The agent can help you to configure the workflow, just connect the Chat Trigger Node in it, more informations, access the notes in the AI Agente Node

## Input & Context
Captures the incoming message from Slack. The "Edit Fields" node cleans and prepares the user's text prompt, ensuring the AI Agent receives the input in the correct format to start processing.

## The AI Brain
This section powers the agent's reasoning. It combines the AI Agent to orchestrate the use of tools, Window Buffer Memory to maintain conversation context (history), and the OpenAI Model to interpret the recruiter's intent.

## Toolset: Tag Management
Enables the AI to organize your ATS data by creating, listing, or deleting tags dynamically based on user requests.

## Toolset: MCP& Token
These tools allow the agent to fetch real-time data from Recrutei, such as active vacancies, specific candidate details, or lists of applicants for a specific role, and others. The Get token node makes a easier way for the user to get their token

## Toolset: Vacancy Comment Management
These tools allow the agent to make complex action involving comments on vacancies

## Toolset: Comment's Answer Management
These tools allows the agent to make answers in vacancies's comments and also listing them

## Toolset: Candidate Prospection 
This tool allows the agent to create a candidate in a vacancy as a prospect, which means that it will have limited informatons, but it is usefull if the recruiter finds a good candidate in a external environment

## Response Delivery
Finally, the agent sends its generated response back to the original Slack thread, completing the interaction loop.
